revised_title: Ocean Waves and the Generation of Microseisms
tldr: The authors propose a theory that ocean waves, specifically second-order pressure variations, can generate microseismic oscillations of the sea bed. They explain that suitable conditions of wave interference may occur at the center of a cyclonic depression or possibly if there is wave reflection from a coast. This theory is supported by observations of Bernard and Deacon, who discovered that the period of microseisms is often half that of the ocean waves associated with them.
